name: Gozim, All wikipedia on a Raspberry Pi
tagline: A Go native implementation for ZIM files
body:
### Serve all Wikipedia from a small server
Gozim is a library and a toolset to achieve reasonable performance on small computers ([Raspberry Pi](http://www.raspberrypi.org/)), to serve a full Wikipedia set.    
Think Internet outages, boats or countries without permanent Internet access, Gozim allows a classroom to work on Wikipedia from anywhere.  

### How does it work ?
Thanks to Kiwix organisation, they provide [a full dump of all Wikipedia entries in different languages](http://download.kiwix.org/zim/) in a single file (around 40GB for english).  
Gozim is capable of reading that file and serve it via HTTP, even on very small servers.  
With a 25$ 64GB USB key and a 35$ [Raspberry Pi](http://www.raspberrypi.org/), you get enough power to serve multiple users.


### Why not using the Kiwix tools ?
Kiwix provides a nice graphical client but nothing to be started automatically, it was a way to improve my Go skills too.


### Technical details
* See [Gozim Github](http://github.com/akhenakh/gozim)
